sen.e: Information
Information
Information

sen.j: 三条京阪駅（さんじょうけいはんえき）は、京都市東山区にある、京都市営地下鉄東西線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: The Sanjyo-Keihan Station is a stop of the Tozai Line, one of Kyoto Municipal Subway Lines, and is located in Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City.
The Sanjyo-Keihan Station is a stop of the Tozai Line, one of Kyoto Municipal Subway Lines, and is located in Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City.
Located in the Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City, Sanjyo-Keihan Station is a stop on the Tozai Line, a Kyoto Municipal Subway Line.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.e: The station number is T11.
The station number is T11.
The station number is T11.

tit.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.e: The Keihan Electric Railway
The Keihan Electric Railway
The Keihan Electric Railway

sen.j: 京阪本線・京阪鴨東線（三条駅 (京都府)）
sen.e: The Keihan Main Line and the Keihan Oto Line at the Sanzyo Station (owned and controlled by Kyoto Prefecture)
The Keihan Main Line and the Keihan Oto Line at the Sanjyo Station (in Kyoto Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 三条の表記を修正。京阪電気鉄道は民間会社である。
sen.e: Keihan Main Line and Keihan Oto Line in Sanjyo Station (in Kyoto Prefecture)
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 地下の改札外コンコースを通じて繋がっている。
sen.e: You can reach there through the underground concourse outside of the ticket gate.
The underground concourse outside of the ticket gate connects the railway lines.
An underground concourse outside its ticket gate connects Sanjyo-Keihan Station to Sanjyo Station.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

tit.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: ホームは地下4層にあり、他の東西線の駅と同様、複線島式ホーム（1面2線）で、プラットホーム安全対策が設置されている。
sen.e: The platform is in the fourth basement, and, just the same as other stations of the Tozai Line, it takes form called an island platform between double tracks (one platform serves two tracks, running opposite) and is equipped with safety measures.

The platform is in the fourth basement, and, just the same as other stations of the Tozai Line, it takes form called an island platform between double tracks (one platform serves two tracks, running opposite) and is equipped with safety measures.

The platform is located on the fourth underground level, as are the platforms of other stations on the Tozai Line. Equipped with safety measures, the platform is what is known as an 'Island Platform,' which is a single platform between double tracks (one platform serving two tracks that run in opposite directions).
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 東西線の駅は駅ごとにステーションカラーが制定されているが、三条京阪駅のステーションカラーは牡丹色。
sen.e: As every other station of the Tozai Line, the Sanjyo-Keihan Station has its own color code, light peony.
As every other station of the Tozai Line, the Sanjyo-Keihan Station has its own color, light peony.
Each station on the Tozai Line has its own color, and the color used at Sanjyo-Keihan Station is scarlet tinged with purple.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

tit.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 駅の周辺およびバスのりばについては三条京阪を参照。
sen.e: Please refer to "Sanjyo-Keihan" for the vicinity, including the location of the bus stop.
Please refer to the page of "Sanjyo-Keihan" for the vicinity, including the location of the bus station.
Refer to Sanjyo-Keihan for details on the station's surroundings, including the location of the bus station.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 地下鉄開業以前から、京都市営バス等ではこの地点名を「三条京阪」と呼んでいる。
sen.e: The Kyoto City Bus and other public transport has been calling this spot "Sanjyo-Keihan"before the start of the subway line's operation.
The Kyoto City Bus and other public transport firms have been calling this spot "Sanjyo-Keihan" since the time before the subway line's operation started.
Kyoto City Bus and other public transport firms have been calling this spot "Sanjyo-Keihan" since before the subway line was opened.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道の三条駅 (京都府)ではなく市営地下鉄のほうが三条京阪駅と他社の名前を名乗っている。
sen.e: But the Sanjyo Station, owned and controlled by Kyoto Prefecture, is the name given to the older Keihan Electric Line, while the newer municipal subway chose Sanjyo-Keihan as its station's name instead.

The municipal subway chose to use the name Sanjyo-Keihan that included the name of other railway company, Keihan, while the Keihan Electric Line did not use their company name and called the station in this area Sanjyo (in Kyoto prefecture).
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映するように修正。京阪電気鉄道は民間会社である。
sen.e: The municipal subway chose to use the name Sanjyo-Keihan because Keihan was the name of another railway company and there was already a station named Sanjyo in Kyoto prefecture.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 1997年10月12日 - 東西線醍醐～二条間開業に伴い設置。
sen.e: The station opened on October 12, 1997, when the Tozai Line began operating between the Daigo Station and the Nijyo Station.
The station opened on October 12, 1997, when the Tozai Line began operating between the Daigo Station and the Nijyo Station.
The station opened on October 12, 1997, when the Tozai Line began operating between Daigo Station and Nijyo Station.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.e: On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa was made available.
On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa card was made available.
sen.cmt: PiTaPaの説明となる言葉、cardを挿入。
sen.e: On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa card was made available.

sen.j: 駅施設は第三セクターである京都市営地下鉄東西線歴史株式会社が建設。
sen.e: The builder of the station facilities was a third sector, called the Historical Corporation of the Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway Lines.
The station facilities were built by a third sector company called the Historical Corporation of the Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway Lines.
The station facilities were built by Historical Corporation of Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway Lines, a third sector company.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: なお、東西線に乗り入れている京阪京津線は元々御陵駅よりこの駅の地上を走っていたことから、当初はこの駅までの乗り入れを予定していたが、この付近では折返し運転をするのに必要なスペースが確保できなかったため、開業時は一つ先の京都市役所前駅までの乗り入れとなった（その後、2008年に東西線が太秦天神川駅へ延長された時に、同駅まで乗り入れ区間が延長されている）。
sen.e: By the way, the Keihan Keishin Line, running on the same tracks of the Tozai Line, formerly ran on the ground from the Misasagi Station through the spot just above this subway station, so they originally planned to share the tracks to here. But they couldn't secure enough space around here for the shuttle service, so, at their restart, they decided to share the rails to the next Kyoto Shiyakusyo-mae Station. (Afterwards, they extended sharing sections to the Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station when the Tozai Line was lengthened to that station in 2008.)

The Keihan Keishin Line, running on the same tracks of the Tozai Line, originally planned to share the tracks to this station because the line formerly ran on the ground just above this subway station, coming from the Misasagi Station. But they couldn't secure enough space around here for the shuttle service, so, when the Sanjyo-Keihan station opened, the Keihan Keishin line shared the rails to the next Kyoto Shiyakusyo-mae Station. (Later, they extended sharing sections to the Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station when the Tozai Line was lengthened to that station in 2008.)

The Keihan Keishin Line uses the same tracks as the Tozai Line. They originally planned to share the tracks to this station because the Keihan Keishin Line ran between Misasagi Station and this station, which was above ground at the time. However, as they were unable to secure enough space around this area for a turnaround, the Keihan Keishin Line decided to extend the shared section to the next station, Kyoto Shiyakusyo-mae, when Sanjyo-Keihan Station was opened. (They later extended the shared section even further to Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station when the Tozai Line was extended to that station in 2008.)
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 東山駅_(京都府)(T10) - 三条京阪駅(T11) - 京都市役所前駅(T12)
sen.e: the Higashiyama Station, owned and controlled by Kyoto Prefecture, numbered T10---the Sanjyo-Keihan Station, numbered T11---the Kyoto Shiyakusyo-mae Station, numbered T12
the Higashiyama Station, owned and controlled by Kyoto Prefecture, numbered T10---the Sanjyo-Keihan Station, numbered T11---the Kyoto Shiyakusyo-mae Station, numbered T12
Higashiyama Station (station number: T10), owned and controlled by Kyoto Prefecture---Sanjyo-Keihan Station (station number: T11)---Kyoto Shiyakusyo-mae Station (station number: T12)
